@inheritdoc IEATBackedPool\n    function deposit(\n        uint256 tokenId,\n        uint256 amount\n    )\n        external virtual\n        returns (uint256 jltQuantity)\n    {\n        return _deposit(_msgSender(), tokenId, amount);\n    }\n\n    /// @inheritdoc IEATBackedPool\n    function depositFrom(\n        address from,\n        uint256 tokenId,\n        uint256 amount\n    )\n        external virtual\n        returns (uint256 jltQuantity)\n    {\n        return _deposit(from, tokenId, amount);\n    }\n\n    /// @inheritdoc IEATBackedPool\n    function depositBatch(\n        address from,\n        uint256[] calldata tokenIds,\n        uint256[] calldata amounts\n    )\n        external virtual\n        nonReentrant\n        returns (uint256 jltQuantity)\n    {\n        IJasmineEAT(eat).safeBatchTransferFrom(from, address(this), tokenIds, amounts, \"\");\n        return _standardizeDecimal(amounts.sum());\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Internal utility function to deposit EATs to pool\n     * \n     * @param from Address from which EATs will be transfered\n     * @param tokenId ID of EAT to deposit into pool\n     * @param amount Number of EATs to deposit\n     * \n     * @return jltQuantity Number of JLTs issued\n     */\n    function _deposit(\n        address from,\n        uint256 tokenId,\n        uint256 amount\n    )\n        internal virtual\n        nonReentrant\n        returns (uint256 jltQuantity)\n    {\n        IJasmineEAT(eat).safeTransferFrom(from, address(this), tokenId, amount, \"\");\n        return _standardizeDecimal(amount);\n    }\n\n\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  Withdrawal Functions  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  \\\\\n\n    /// @inheritdoc IEATBackedPool\n    function withdraw(\n        address recipient,\n        uint256 amount,\n        bytes calldata data\n    )\n        external virtual\n        returns (\n            uint256[] memory tokenIds,\n            uint256[] memory amounts\n        )\n    {\n        return _withdraw(\n            _msgSender(),\n            recipient,\n            amount,\n            data\n        );\n    }\n\n    /// @inheritdoc IEATBackedPool\n    function withdrawFrom(\n        address from,\n        address recipient,\n        uint256 amount,\n        bytes calldata data\n    )\n        external virtual\n        returns (\n            uint256[] memory tokenIds,\n            uint256[] memory amounts\n        )\n    {\n        return _withdraw(\n            from,\n            recipient,\n            amount,\n            data\n        );\n    }\n\n    /// @inheritdoc IEATBackedPool\n    function withdrawSpecific(\n        address from,\n        address recipient,\n        uint256[] calldata tokenIds,\n        uint256[] calldata amounts,\n        bytes calldata data\n    ) \n        external virtual\n    {\n        _withdraw(\n            from,\n            recipient,\n            tokenIds,\n            amounts,\n            data\n        );\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Internal utility function for withdrawing EATs where \n     *      the pool selects the EATs to withdraw\n     * \n     * @param from JLT holder from which token will be burned\n     * @param recipient Address to receive EATs\n     * @param tokenIds EAT token IDs to withdraw\n     * @param amounts EAT token amounts to withdraw\n     * @param data Calldata relayed during EAT transfer\n     */\n    function _withdraw(\n        address from,\n        address recipient,\n        uint256 amount,\n        bytes memory data\n    ) \n        internal virtual\n        withdrawal nonReentrant\n        returns (\n            uint256[] memory tokenIds,\n            uint256[] memory amounts\n        )\n    {\n        // 1. Ensure spender has sufficient JLTs and lengths match\n        uint256 cost = JasmineBasePool.withdrawalCost(amount);\n\n        // 2. Burn Tokens\n        _spendJLT(from, cost);\n\n        // 3. Transfer Select Tokens\n        (tokenIds, amounts) = _transferQueuedDeposits(recipient, amount, data);\n\n        // 4. Emit Withdrawal event\n        emit Withdraw(from, recipient, amount);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Internal utility function for withdrawing EATs from pool\n     *      in exchange for JLTs\n     * \n     * @param from JLT holder from which token will be burned\n     * @param recipient Address to receive EATs\n     * @param tokenIds EAT token IDs to withdraw\n     * @param amounts EAT token amounts to withdraw\n     * @param data Calldata relayed during EAT transfer\n     */\n    function _withdraw(\n        address from,\n        address recipient,\n        uint256[] memory tokenIds,\n        uint256[] memory amounts,\n        bytes memory data\n    ) \n        internal virtual\n        withdrawal nonReentrant\n    {\n        // 1. Ensure spender has sufficient JLTs and lengths match\n        uint256 cost = JasmineBasePool.withdrawalCost(tokenIds, amounts);\n\n        // 2. Burn Tokens\n        _spendJLT(from, cost);\n\n        // 3. Transfer Select Tokens\n        _transferDeposits(recipient, tokenIds, amounts, data);\n\n        // 4. Emit Withdrawal event\n        emit Withdraw(from, recipient, amounts.sum());\n    }\n\n\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  Retirement Functions  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  \\\\\n\n    /// @inheritdoc IRetireablePool\n    function retire(\n        address from, \n        address beneficiary,\n        uint256 amount, \n        bytes calldata data\n    )\n        external virtual\n    {\n        _retire(from, beneficiary, amount, data);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Internal function to execute retirements\n     * \n     * @param from Address from which to burn JLT\n     * @param beneficiary Address to receive retirement accredidation\n     * @param amount Number of JLT to return\n     * @param data Additional data to encode in retirement\n     */\n    function _retire(\n        address from, \n        address beneficiary,\n        uint256 amount, \n        bytes calldata data\n    )\n        internal virtual\n        withdrawal nonReentrant\n    {\n        // 1. Burn JLTs from owner\n        uint256 cost = JasmineBasePool.retirementCost(amount);\n        _spendJLT(from, cost);\n\n        // 2. Select quantity of EATs to retire\n        uint256 eatQuantity = _totalDeposits - Math.ceilDiv(totalSupply(), 10 ** decimals());\n\n        // 3. Encode transfer data\n        bool hasFractional = eatQuantity > (amount / (10 ** decimals()));\n        bytes memory retirementData;\n\n        if (eatQuantity == 0) {\n            emit Retirement(from, beneficiary, amount);\n            return;\n        } else if (hasFractional && eatQuantity == 1) {\n            retirementData = Calldata.encodeFractionalRetirementData();\n        } else {\n            retirementData = Calldata.encodeRetirementData(beneficiary, hasFractional);\n        }\n\n        if (data.length != 0) {\n            retirementData = abi.encode(retirementData, data);\n        }\n\n        // 4. Send to retirement service and emit retirement event\n        _transferQueuedDeposits(retirementService, eatQuantity, retirementData);\n\n        emit Retirement(from, beneficiary, amount);\n    }\n\n\n    // \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n    IJasmineEAT(eat).frozen.selector\n        );\n    }\n\n    // abi.encodePacked(JasminePoolFactory(poolFactory).poolsBaseURI(), _symbol)\n        );\n    }\n\n    // IERC165\n     * @dev See {IERC165-supportsInterface}\n     */\n    function supportsInterface(bytes4 interfaceId)\n        public view virtual\n        override(EATManager, ERC20Permit)\n        returns (bool)\n    {\n        return interfaceId == type(IJasminePool).interfaceId ||\n            interfaceId == type(IERC1046).interfaceId ||\n            super.supportsInterface(interfaceId);\n    }\n\n\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n    //  Token Transfer Functions\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  EAT Manager Deposit Hooks  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  \\\\\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Enforce EAT eligibility before deposits\n     * \n     * @param tokenIds ERC-1155 token IDs received\n     */\n    function _beforeDeposit(\n        address,\n        uint256[] memory tokenIds,\n        uint256[] memory\n    )\n        internal view override\n    {\n        _enforceEligibility(tokenIds);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Mint JLTs to depositor following EAT deposit\n     * \n     * @param operator Address which initiated the deposit\n     * @param from Address from which ERC-1155 tokens were transferred\n     * @param quantity Number of ERC-1155 tokens received\n     * \n     * Emits a {Withdraw} event.\n     */\n    function _afterDeposit(address operator, address from, uint256 quantity) \n        internal override\n    {\n        _mint(\n            from,\n            _standardizeDecimal(quantity)\n        );\n\n        emit Deposit(operator, from, quantity);\n    }\n\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  Deposit Flagging Functions  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  \\\\\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Checks if an EAT depositted into the pool is frozen and validates internal\n     *      balance for token. If frozen, it is internally removed from the pool's\n     *      list of withdrawable tokens. If internal count does not match balance,\n     *      caller will have their JLT burned to rectify the inbalance.\n     * \n     * @param tokenId EAT token ID to check\n     */\n    function validateDepositValidity(uint256 tokenId) external nonReentrant returns (bool isValid) {\n        if (!_isTokenInRecords(tokenId)) {\n            revert JasmineErrors.InvalidInput();\n        }\n\n        uint256 preTotalDeposits = _totalDeposits;\n        bool isFrozen = IJasmineEAT(eat).frozen(tokenId);\n        bool wasUpdated = _updateTokenStatus(tokenId, !isFrozen) || _validateInternalBalance(tokenId);\n        \n        if (wasUpdated) {\n            uint256 changeInDeposits = Math.max(_totalDeposits, preTotalDeposits) - Math.min(_totalDeposits, preTotalDeposits);\n            isValid = changeInDeposits == 0;\n            if (isValid) return true;\n\n            if (preTotalDeposits < _totalDeposits) {\n                _burn(_msgSender(), _standardizeDecimal(changeInDeposits));\n            } else {\n                _mint(_msgSender(), _standardizeDecimal(changeInDeposits));\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n    //  Internal\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Standardizes an integers input to the pool's ERC-20 decimal storage value\n     * \n     * @param input Integer value to standardize\n     * \n     * @return value Decimal value of input per pool's decimal specificity\n     */\n    function _standardizeDecimal(uint256 input) \n        private pure\n        returns (uint256 value)\n    {\n        return input * (10 ** 18);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Private function for burning JLT and decreasing allowance\n     */\n    function _spendJLT(address from, uint256 amount)\n        private\n    {\n        if (amount == 0) revert JasmineErrors.InvalidInput();\n        else if (from != _msgSender()) {\n            _spendAllowance(from, _msgSender(), amount);\n        }\n\n        _burn(from, amount);\n    }\n\n    // \\\\\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Utility function to enforce eligibility of many EATs\n     * \n     * @dev Throws Unqualified(uint256 tokenId) on failure\n     * \n     * @param tokenIds EAT token IDs to check eligibility\n     */\n    function _enforceEligibility(uint256[] memory tokenIds)\n        private view\n    {\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < tokenIds.length;) {\n            if    /**\n     * @param _eat Jasmine EAT contract whose tokens may be deposited\n     */\n    constructor(address _eat) {\n        eat = _eat;\n\n        _isUnlocked = WITHDRAWS_LOCK;\n    }\n\n    //    //  Hooks\n    //    function _beforeDeposit(address from, uint256[] memory tokenIds, uint256[] memory values) internal virtual;\n    function _afterDeposit(address operator, address from, uint256 quantity) internal virtual;\n\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n    //  ERC-1155 Deposit Functions\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n\n    /// @inheritdoc IERC1155Receiver\n    function onERC1155Received(\n        address operator,\n        address from,\n        uint256 tokenId,\n        uint256 value,\n        bytes memory\n    )\n        external\n        returns (bytes4)\n    {\n        _enforceTokenCaller();\n\n        _beforeDeposit(from, _asSingletonArray(tokenId), _asSingletonArray(value));\n        _addDeposit(tokenId, value);\n        _afterDeposit(operator, from, value);\n\n        return this.onERC1155Received.selector;\n    }\n\n    /// @inheritdoc IERC1155Receiver\n    function onERC1155BatchReceived(\n        address operator,\n        address from,\n        uint256[] memory tokenIds,\n        uint256[] memory values,\n        bytes memory\n    )\n        external\n        returns (bytes4)\n    {\n        _enforceTokenCaller();\n\n        _beforeDeposit(from, tokenIds, values);\n        uint256 quantityDeposited = _addDeposits(tokenIds, values);\n        _afterDeposit(operator, from, quantityDeposited);\n\n        return this.onERC1155BatchReceived.selector;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc IERC165\n     * @dev See {IERC165-supportsInterface}.\n     */\n    function supportsInterface(bytes4 interfaceId) public view virtual returns (bool) {\n        return interfaceId == type(IERC1155Receiver).interfaceId || \n            interfaceId == type(IERC165).interfaceId;\n    }\n\n\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n    //  Deposit Modifying Functions\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Internal utility for sending specific tokens out of the contract.\n     * \n     * @dev Requires withdraws to be unlocked via \"unlocked\" modifier.\n     * \n     * @param recipient Address to receive tokens\n     * @param tokenIds Token IDs held by the contract to transfer\n     * @param values Number of tokens to transfer for each token ID\n     * @param data Additional calldata to include in transfer\n     */\n    function _transferDeposits(\n        address recipient,\n        uint256[] memory tokenIds,\n        uint256[] memory values,\n        bytes memory data\n    )\n        internal\n        withdrawsUnlocked\n    {\n        if (tokenIds.length == 1) {\n            _removeDeposit(tokenIds[0], values[0]);\n            IERC1155(eat).safeTransferFrom(\n                address(this),\n                recipient,\n                tokenIds[0],\n                values[0],\n                data\n            );\n        } else {\n            _removeDeposits(tokenIds, values);\n            IERC1155(eat).safeBatchTransferFrom(\n                address(this),\n                recipient,\n                tokenIds,\n                values,\n                data\n            );\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Internal utility for sending tokens out of the contract where\n     *      the contract selects the tokens, ordered by vintage, to send.\n     * \n     * @dev Requires withdraws to be unlocked via \"unlocked\" modifier.\n     * \n     * @param recipient Address to receive tokens\n     * @param amount Total number of tokens to transfer\n     * @param data Additional calldata to include in transfer\n     */\n    function _transferQueuedDeposits(\n        address recipient,\n        uint256 amount,\n        bytes memory data\n    ) \n        internal\n        withdrawsUnlocked\n        returns (\n            uint256[] memory tokenIds,\n            uint256[] memory amounts\n        )\n    {\n        (uint256 withdrawLength, uint256 finalAmount, bool popLast) = _queuedTokenLength(amount);\n        if (withdrawLength == 1) {\n            if (popLast) {\n                tokenIds = _asSingletonArray(_decodeDeposit(_depositsList.popFront()));\n            } else {\n                tokenIds = _asSingletonArray(_decodeDeposit(_depositsList.front()));\n            }\n            amounts = _asSingletonArray(finalAmount);\n            \n            _removeDeposit(tokenIds[0], finalAmount);\n            IERC1155(eat).safeTransferFrom(\n                address(this),\n                recipient,\n                tokenIds[0],\n                finalAmount,\n                data\n            );\n        } else {\n            tokenIds = _decodeDeposits(_depositsList.popFront(withdrawLength, !popLast));\n            amounts = IERC1155(eat).balanceOfBatch(ArrayUtils.fill(address(this), withdrawLength), tokenIds);\n            amounts[withdrawLength-1] = finalAmount;\n\n            _removeDeposits(tokenIds, amounts);\n            IERC1155(eat).safeBatchTransferFrom(\n                address(this),\n                recipient,\n                tokenIds,\n                amounts,\n                data\n            );\n        }\n    }\n\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n    //  Withdrawal Internal Utilities\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Determines the number of token IDs required to get \"amount\" withdrawn\n     * \n     * @param amount Number of tokens to withdraw from contract\n     */\n    function _queuedTokenLength(uint256 amount)\n        private view \n        returns (\n            uint256 length,\n            uint256 finalWithdrawAmount,\n            bool fullAmountOfLastToken\n        ) \n    {\n        uint256 sum = 0;\n        uint256 current = LIST_HEAD;\n        bool exists = true;\n\n        while (sum != amount && exists) {\n            (exists, current) = _depositsList.getNextNode(current);\n            \n            if (!exists) continue;\n\n            uint256 balance = _balances[current];\n\n            if (sum + balance < amount) {\n                unchecked {\n                    sum += balance;\n                    length++;\n                }\n            } else {\n                unchecked {\n                    finalWithdrawAmount = amount - sum;\n                    sum = amount;\n                    length++;\n                }\n                break;\n            }\n        }\n\n        fullAmountOfLastToken = finalWithdrawAmount == _balances[current];\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Internal function to select tokens to withdraw from the contract\n     * \n     * @param amount Number of tokens to withdraw from contract\n     * \n     * @return tokenIds Token IDs to withdraw\n     * @return amounts Number of tokens to withdraw for each token ID\n     */\n    function selectWithdrawTokens(uint256 amount)\n        public view\n        returns (\n            uint256[] memory tokenIds,\n            uint256[] memory amounts\n        )\n    {\n        (uint256 withdrawLength, uint256 finalAmount,) = _queuedTokenLength(amount);\n\n        uint256 current = LIST_HEAD;\n        tokenIds = new uint256[](withdrawLength);\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < withdrawLength;) {\n            (,current) = _depositsList.getNextNode(current);\n            tokenIds[i] = _decodeDeposit(current);\n\n            unchecked {\n                i++;\n            }\n        }\n        amounts = IERC1155(eat).balanceOfBatch(ArrayUtils.fill(address(this), withdrawLength), tokenIds);\n        amounts[withdrawLength-1] = finalAmount;\n\n        return (tokenIds, amounts);\n    }\n\n\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n    //  Deposit Management Functions\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  Adding Deposits  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  \\\\\n\n    /**\n     * function _addDeposit(\n        uint256 tokenId,\n        uint256 value\n    )\n        private\n    {\n        // 1. This includes\n     * minting and burning.\n     *\n     * Calling conditions:\n     *\n     * - when `from` and `to` are both non-zero, `amount` of ``from``'s tokens\n     * will be transferred to `to`.\n     * - when `from` is zero, `amount` tokens will be minted for `to`.\n     * - when `to` is zero, `amount` of ``from``'s tokens will be burned.\n     * - `from` and `to` are never both zero.\n     *\n     * To learn more about hooks, head to xref:ROOT:extending-contracts.adoc#using-hooks[Using Hooks].\n     */\n    function _beforeTokenTransfer(address from, address to, uint256 amount) internal virtual {}\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Hook that is called after any transfer of tokens. This includes\n     * minting and burning.\n     *\n     * Calling conditions:\n     *\n     * - when `from` and `to` are both non-zero, `amount` of ``from``'s tokens\n     * has been transferred to `to`.\n     * - when `from` is zero, `amount` tokens have been minted for `to`.\n     * - when `to` is zero, `amount` of ``from``'s tokens have been burned.\n     * - `from` and `to` are never both zero.\n     *\n     * To learn more about hooks, head to xref:ROOT:extending-contracts.adoc#using-hooks[Using Hooks].\n     */\n    function _afterTokenTransfer(address from, address to, uint256 amount) internal virtual {}\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {IERC165-supportsInterface}.\n     */\n    function supportsInterface(bytes4 interfaceId)\n        public view virtual\n        override\n        returns (bool)\n    {\n        return\n            interfaceId == type(IERC20).interfaceId ||\n            interfaceId == type(IERC20Metadata).interfaceId ||\n            super.supportsInterface(interfaceId);\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0xdbb66bd57f7d18425143d2258210a56b0a536149a335c24c6b233989fdd25202","license":"MIT"},"contracts/pools/core/implementations/ERC20Permit.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\n// OpenZeppelin Contracts (last updated v4.9.0) (token/ERC20/extensions/ERC20Permit.sol)\n\npragma solidity ^0.8.0;\n\nimport { IERC20Permit } from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/extensions/IERC20Permit.sol\";\nimport { ERC20 }        from \"./ERC20.sol\";\nimport { ECDSA }        from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/cryptography/ECDSA.sol\";\nimport { EIP712 }       from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/cryptography/EIP712.sol\";\nimport { Counters }     from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/Counters.sol\";\n\n/**\n * @dev Implementation of the ERC20 Permit extension allowing approvals to be made via signatures, as defined in\n * https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2612[EIP-2612].\n *\n * Adds the {permit} method, which can be used to change an account's ERC20 allowance (see {IERC20-allowance}) by\n * presenting a message signed by the account. By not relying on `{IERC20-approve}`, the token holder account doesn't\n * need to send a transaction, and thus is not required to hold Ether at all.\n *\n * _Available since v3.4._\n */\nabstract contract ERC20Permit is ERC20, IERC20Permit, EIP712 {\n    using Counters for Counters.Counter;\n\n    mapping(address => Counters.Counter) private _nonces;\n\n    // solhint-disable-next-line var-name-mixedcase\n    bytes32 private constant _PERMIT_TYPEHASH =\n        keccak256(\"Permit(address owner,address spender,uint256 value,uint256 nonce,uint256 deadline)\");\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Permit deadline has expired.\n     */\n    error ERC2612ExpiredSignature(uint256 deadline);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Mismatched signature.\n     */\n    error ERC2612InvalidSigner(address signer, address owner);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev In previous versions `_PERMIT_TYPEHASH` was declared as `immutable`.\n     * However, to ensure consistency with the upgradeable transpiler, we will continue\n     * to reserve a slot.\n     * @custom:oz-renamed-from _PERMIT_TYPEHASH\n     */\n    // solhint-disable-next-line var-name-mixedcase\n    bytes32 private _PERMIT_TYPEHASH_DEPRECATED_SLOT;\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Initializes the {EIP712} domain separator using the `name` parameter, and setting `version` to `\"1\"`.\n     *\n     * It's a good idea to use the same `name` that is defined as the ERC20 token name.\n     */\n    constructor(string memory name) EIP712(name, \"1\") {}  // solhint-disable-line no-empty-blocks\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {IERC20Permit-permit}.\n     */\n    function permit(\n        address owner,\n        address spender,\n        uint256 value,\n        uint256 deadline,\n        uint8 v,\n        bytes32 r,\n        bytes32 s\n    ) public virtual override {\n        if (block.timestamp > deadline) {\n            revert ERC2612ExpiredSignature(deadline);\n        }\n\n        bytes32 structHash = keccak256(abi.encode(_PERMIT_TYPEHASH, owner, spender, value, _useNonce(owner), deadline));\n\n        bytes32 hash = _hashTypedDataV4(structHash);\n\n        address signer = ECDSA.recover(hash, v, r, s);\n        if (signer != owner) {\n            revert ERC2612InvalidSigner(signer, owner);\n        }\n\n        _approve(owner, spender, value);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {IERC20Permit-nonces}.\n     */\n    function nonces(address owner) public view virtual override returns (uint256) {\n        return _nonces[owner].current();\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {IERC20Permit-DOMAIN_SEPARATOR}.\n     */\n    // solhint-disable-next-line func-name-mixedcase\n    function DOMAIN_SEPARATOR() external view override returns (bytes32) {\n        return _domainSeparatorV4();\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev \"Consume a nonce\": return the current value and increment.\n     *\n     * _Available since v4.1._\n     */\n    function _useNonce(address owner) internal virtual returns (uint256 current) {\n        Counters.Counter storage nonce = _nonces[owner];\n        current = nonce.current();\n        nonce.increment();\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {IERC165-supportsInterface}.\n     */\n    function supportsInterface(bytes4 interfaceId)\n        public view virtual\n        override\n        returns (bool)\n    {\n        return\n            interfaceId == type(IERC20Permit).interfaceId ||\n            super.supportsInterface(interfaceId);\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0xcdd1830c7eaaf80fb3933d8a6cba6cc358cb94c7176590c89d85bfa367e49ba6","license":"MIT"},"contracts/pools/extensions/JasmineFeePool.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: BUSL-1.1\n\npragma solidity ^0.8.0;\n\n//  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  Imports  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  \\\\\n\n// Inheritted Contracts\nimport { JasmineBasePool } from \"../core/JasmineBasePool.sol\";\n\n// Implemented Interfaces\nimport { IJasmineEATBackedPool  as IEATBackedPool }  from \"../../interfaces/pool/IEATBackedPool.sol\";\nimport { IJasmineFeePool        as IFeePool }        from \"../../interfaces/pool/IFeePool.sol\";\nimport { IJasmineRetireablePool as IRetireablePool } from \"../../interfaces/pool/IRetireablePool.sol\";\nimport { JasmineErrors }                             from \"../../interfaces/errors/JasmineErrors.sol\";\n\n// External Contracts\nimport { IJasmineFeeManager } from \"../../interfaces/IJasmineFeeManager.sol\";\n\n// Utility Libraries\nimport { Math } from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/math/Math.sol\";\n\n\n/**\n * @title Jasmine Fee Pool\n * @author Kai Aldag<kai.aldag@jasmine.energy>\n * @notice Extends JasmineBasePool with withdrawal and retirement fees managed by\n *         a protocol wide fee manager roll.\n * @custom:security-contact dev@jasmine.energy\n */\nabstract contract JasmineFeePool is JasmineBasePool, IFeePool {\n\n    // \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n    // Fields\n    // \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n\n    /// @dev Fee for withdrawals in basis points\n    uint96 private _withdrawalRate;\n\n    /// @dev Fee for withdrawals in basis points\n    uint96 private _withdrawalSpecificRate;\n\n    /// @dev Fee for retirements in basis points\n    uint96 private  _retirementRate;\n\n\n    // \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n    // Setup\n    // \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n\n    /**\n     * @param _eat Jasmine Energy Attribute Token address\n     * @param _poolFactory Jasmine Pool Factory address\n     * @param _minter Address of the Jasmine Minter address\n     * @param _contractName Name of the pool contract per EIP-712 and ERC-20\n     */\n    constructor(\n        address _eat,\n        address _poolFactory,\n        address _minter,\n        string memory _contractName\n    )\n        JasmineBasePool(_eat, _poolFactory, _minter, _contractName)\n    { } // solhint-disable-line no-empty-blocks\n\n\n    // \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n    // User Functionality\n    // \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  Retirement Functions  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  \\\\\n\n    /// @inheritdoc JasmineBasePool\n    function retire(\n        address from,\n        address beneficiary,\n        uint256 amount,\n        bytes calldata data\n    )\n        external virtual \n        override(IRetireablePool, JasmineBasePool)\n    {\n        // 1. If fee is set, calculate fee to take from amount given\n        if (retirementRate() != 0) {\n            uint256 feeAmount = Math.ceilDiv(amount, retirementRate());\n            // 1.1 If from if not caller, decrease allowance\n            if (from != _msgSender()) {\n                _spendAllowance(from, _msgSender(), feeAmount);\n            }\n            _transfer(\n                from,\n                IJasmineFeeManager(poolFactory).feeBeneficiary(),\n                feeAmount\n            );\n            amount -= feeAmount;\n        }\n\n        // 2. Execute retirement\n        _retire(from, beneficiary, amount, data);\n    }\n\n    /// @inheritdoc IFeePool\n    function retireExact(\n        address from, \n        address beneficiary, \n        uint256 amount, \n        bytes calldata data\n    )\n        external virtual\n    {\n        // 1. If fee is set, calculate excess fee on top of given amount\n        if (retirementRate() != 0) {\n            uint256 feeAmount = retirementCost(amount) - amount;\n            // 1.1 If from if not caller, decrease allowance\n            if (from != _msgSender()) {\n                _spendAllowance(from, _msgSender(), feeAmount);\n            }\n            _transfer(\n                from,\n                IJasmineFeeManager(poolFactory).feeBeneficiary(),\n                feeAmount\n            );\n        }\n        \n        // 2. Execute retirement\n        _retire(from, beneficiary, amount, data);\n    }\n\n\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  Withdrawal Functions  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  \\\\\n\n\n    /// @inheritdoc JasmineBasePool\n    function withdraw(\n        address recipient,\n        uint256 amount,\n        bytes calldata data\n    )\n        external virtual\n        override(IEATBackedPool, JasmineBasePool)\n        returns (\n            uint256[] memory tokenIds,\n            uint256[] memory amounts\n        )\n    {\n        // 1. If fee is not 0, calculate and take fee from caller\n        if (withdrawalRate() != 0) {\n            uint256 feeAmount = JasmineFeePool.withdrawalCost(amount) - super.withdrawalCost(amount);\n            _transfer(\n                _msgSender(),\n                IJasmineFeeManager(poolFactory).feeBeneficiary(),\n                feeAmount\n            );\n        }\n\n        // 2. Execute withdrawal\n        return _withdraw(\n            _msgSender(),\n            recipient,\n            amount,\n            data\n        );\n    }\n\n    /// @inheritdoc JasmineBasePool\n    function withdrawFrom(\n        address from,\n        address recipient,\n        uint256 amount,\n        bytes calldata data\n    )\n        external virtual \n        override(IEATBackedPool, JasmineBasePool)\n        returns (\n            uint256[] memory tokenIds,\n            uint256[] memory amounts\n        )\n    {\n        // 1. If fee is not 0, calculate and take fee from caller\n        if (withdrawalRate() != 0) {\n            uint256 feeAmount = JasmineFeePool.withdrawalCost(amount) - super.withdrawalCost(amount);\n            // 1.1 If spender if not caller, decrease allowance\n            if (from != _msgSender()) {\n                _spendAllowance(from, _msgSender(), feeAmount);\n            }\n            _transfer(\n                from,\n                IJasmineFeeManager(poolFactory).feeBeneficiary(),\n                feeAmount\n            );\n        }\n\n        // 2. Execute withdrawal\n        return _withdraw(\n            from,\n            recipient,\n            amount,\n            data\n        );\n    }\n\n    /// @inheritdoc IEATBackedPool\n    function withdrawSpecific(\n        address from,\n        address recipient,\n        uint256[] calldata tokenIds,\n        uint256[] calldata amounts,\n        bytes calldata data\n    ) \n        external virtual \n        override(IEATBackedPool, JasmineBasePool)\n    {\n        // 1. If fee is not 0, calculate and take fee from caller\n        if (withdrawalSpecificRate() != 0) {\n            uint256 feeAmount = JasmineFeePool.withdrawalCost(tokenIds, amounts) - super.withdrawalCost(tokenIds, amounts);\n            // 1.1 If spender if not caller, decrease allowance\n            if (from != _msgSender()) {\n                _spendAllowance(from, _msgSender(), feeAmount);\n            }\n            _transfer(\n                from,\n                IJasmineFeeManager(poolFactory).feeBeneficiary(),\n                feeAmount\n            );\n        }\n\n        // 2. Execute withdrawal\n        _withdraw(\n            from,\n            recipient,\n            tokenIds,\n            amounts,\n            data\n        );\n    }\n\n\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  Costing Functions  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  \\\\\n\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Returns the pool's JLT withdrawal rate in basis points\n     * \n     * @dev If pool's withdrawal rate is not set, defer to pool factory's base rate\n     * \n     * @return Withdrawal fee in basis points\n     */\n    function withdrawalRate() public view returns (uint96) {\n        if (IJasmineFeeManager(poolFactory).feeBeneficiary() == address(0x0)) {\n            return 0;\n        } else if (_withdrawalRate != 0) {\n            return _withdrawalRate;\n        } else {\n            return IJasmineFeeManager(poolFactory).baseWithdrawalRate();\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Returns the pool's JLT withdrawal rate for withdrawing specific tokens,\n     *         in basis points\n     * \n     * @dev If pool's specific withdrawal rate is not set, defer to pool factory's base rate\n     * \n     * @return Withdrawal fee in basis points\n     */\n    function withdrawalSpecificRate() public view returns (uint96) {\n        if (IJasmineFeeManager(poolFactory).feeBeneficiary() == address(0x0)) {\n            return 0;\n        } else if (_withdrawalSpecificRate != 0) {\n            return _withdrawalSpecificRate;\n        } else {\n            return IJasmineFeeManager(poolFactory).baseWithdrawalSpecificRate();\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Returns the pool's JLT retirement rate in basis points\n     * \n     * @dev If pool's retirement rate is not set, defer to pool factory's base rate\n     * \n     * @return Retirement rate in basis points\n     */\n    function retirementRate() public view returns (uint96) {\n        if (IJasmineFeeManager(poolFactory).feeBeneficiary() == address(0x0)) {\n            return 0;\n        } else if ( _retirementRate != 0) {\n            return  _retirementRate;\n        } else {\n            return IJasmineFeeManager(poolFactory).baseRetirementRate();\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Cost of withdrawing specified amounts of tokens from pool including\n     *         withdrawal fee.\n     * \n     * @param tokenIds IDs of EATs to withdaw\n     * @param amounts Amounts of EATs to withdaw\n     * \n     * @return cost Price of withdrawing EATs in JLTs\n     */\n    function withdrawalCost(\n        uint256[] memory tokenIds,\n        uint256[] memory amounts\n    )\n        public view virtual \n        override(IEATBackedPool, JasmineBasePool)\n        returns (uint256 cost)\n    {\n        if (tokenIds.length != amounts.length) {\n            revert JasmineErrors.InvalidInput();\n        }\n        return Math.mulDiv(\n            super.withdrawalCost(tokenIds, amounts), \n            (withdrawalRate() + 10_000), \n            10_000\n        );\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Cost of withdrawing amount of tokens from pool where pool\n     *         selects the tokens to withdraw, including withdrawal fee.\n     * \n     * @param amount Number of EATs to withdraw.\n     * \n     * @return cost Price of withdrawing EATs in JLTs\n     */\n    function withdrawalCost(\n        uint256 amount\n    )\n        public view virtual \n        override(IEATBackedPool, JasmineBasePool)\n        returns (uint256 cost)\n    {\n        return Math.mulDiv(\n            super.withdrawalCost(amount), \n            (withdrawalSpecificRate() + 10_000), \n            10_000\n        );\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Cost of retiring JLTs from pool including retirement fees.\n     * \n     * @param amount Amount of JLTs to retire.\n     * \n     * @return cost Price of retiring in JLTs.\n     */\n    function retirementCost(\n        uint256 amount\n    )\n        public view virtual \n        override(IRetireablePool, JasmineBasePool)\n        returns (uint256 cost)\n    {\n        return Math.mulDiv(\n            super.retirementCost(amount), \n            (retirementRate() + 10_000), \n            10_000\n        );\n    }\n\n    // \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n    // Admin Functionality\n    // \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Allows pool fee managers to update the withdrawal rate\n     * \n     * @dev Requirements:\n     *     - Caller must have fee manager role - in pool factory\n     * \n     * @dev emits WithdrawalRateUpdate\n     * \n     * @param newWithdrawalRate New rate on withdrawals in basis points\n     * @param isSpecificRate Whether the new rate is for specific tokens or any\n     */\n    function updateWithdrawalRate(uint96 newWithdrawalRate, bool isSpecificRate) external {\n        _enforceFeeManagerRole();\n        _updateWithdrawalRate(newWithdrawalRate, isSpecificRate);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Allows pool fee managers to update the retirement rate\n     * \n     * @dev Requirements:\n     *     - Caller must have fee manager role - in pool factory\n     * \n     * @dev emits RetirementRateUpdate\n     * \n     * @param newRetirementRate New rate on retirements in basis points\n     */\n    function updateRetirementRate(uint96 newRetirementRate) external {\n        _enforceFeeManagerRole();\n        _updateRetirementRate(newRetirementRate);\n    }\n\n\n    //    //  Internal\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\n\n    //  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  Fee Management  \u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500\u2500  \\\\\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Internal method for setting withdrawal rate\n     * \n     * @param newWithdrawalRate New rate on withdrawals in basis points\n     * @param isSpecific Whether the rate is for specific or pool selected withdrawals\n     */\n    function _updateWithdrawalRate(uint96 newWithdrawalRate, bool isSpecific) private {\n        if (isSpecific) {\n            _withdrawalSpecificRate = newWithdrawalRate;\n        } else {\n            _withdrawalRate = newWithdrawalRate;\n        }\n\n        emit WithdrawalRateUpdate(newWithdrawalRate, _msgSender(), isSpecific);\n    }\n\n    /**\n InvalidTokenAddress(address,address).details: Emitted if tokens (ERC-1155) are received from incorrect contract

RequiresRole(bytes32).details: Emitted if access control check fails

Unqualified(uint256).details: Emitted if a token does not meet pool's deposit policy

UnsupportedMetadataVersion(uint8).details: Emitted if contract does not support metadata version

WithdrawBlocked(uint256).details: Emitted if a token is unable to be withdrawn from pool

Approval(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance.

Deposit(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted whenever EATs are deposited to the contract

params.quantity: Number of EATs deposited. Note: JLTs issued are 1-1 with EATs

EIP712DomainChanged().details: MAY be emitted to signal that the domain could have changed.

Initialized(uint8).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

Retirement(address,address,uint256).details: must be accompanied by a token burn event

RetirementRateUpdate(uint96,address).details: Emitted whenever fee manager updates retirement fee

params.retirementFeeBips: new retirement fee in basis points

Transfer(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `value` tokens are moved from one account (`from`) to another (`to`). Note that `value` may be zero.

Withdraw(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted whenever EATs are withdrawn from the contract

WithdrawalRateUpdate(uint96,address,bool.details: Emitted whenever fee manager updates withdrawal fee

params.isSpecificRate: Whether fee was update for specific withdrawals or any
params.withdrawFeeBips: New withdrawal fee in basis points

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `amount` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

params._eat: Address of the Jasmine Energy Attribution Token (EAT) contract
params._minter: Address of the Jasmine Minter address
params._oracle: Address of the Jasmine Oracle contract
params._poolFactory: Address of the Jasmine Pool Factory contract

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the default value returned by this function, unless it's overridden. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

deposit(uint256,uint256).details: Requirements:     - Pool must be an approved operator of from address

params.quantity: Number of EATs for given tokenId to deposit

returns.jltQuantity: Number of JLTs issued for deposit  Emits a {Deposit} event.

depositBatch(address,uint256[],uint256[].details: Requirements:     - Pool must be an approved operator of from address     - Lenght of tokenIds and quantities must match

params.from: Address from which to transfer EATs to pool
params.quantities: Number of EATs for tokenId at same index to deposit

returns.jltQuantity: Number of JLTs issued for deposit  Emits a {Deposit} event.

depositFrom(address,uint256,uint256).details: Requirements:     - Pool must be an approved operator of from address     - msg.sender must be approved for the user's tokens

params.from: Address from which to transfer EATs to pool
params.quantity: Number of EATs for given tokenId to deposit

returns.jltQuantity: Number of JLTs issued for deposit  Emits a {Deposit} event.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

initialize(bytes,string,string).details: Initializer function for proxy deployments to call. Requirements:     - Caller must be factory

meetsPolicy(uint256).details: Checks if a token is eligible for deposit into the pool based on the      pool's Deposit Policy.

params.tokenId: EAT token ID to check eligibility

onERC1155BatchReceived(address,address,u.details: Handles the receipt of a multiple ERC1155 token types. This function is called at the end of a `safeBatchTransferFrom` after the balances have been updated. NOTE: To accept the transfer(s), this must return `bytes4(keccak256("onERC1155BatchReceived(address,address,uint256[],uint256[],bytes)"))` (i.e. 0xbc197c81, or its own function selector).

params.data: Additional data with no specified format
params.from: The address which previously owned the token
params.ids: An array containing ids of each token being transferred (order and length must match values array)
params.operator: The address which initiated the batch transfer (i.e. msg.sender)
params.values: An array containing amounts of each token being transferred (order and length must match ids array)

onERC1155Received(address,address,uint25.details: Handles the receipt of a single ERC1155 token type. This function is called at the end of a `safeTransferFrom` after the balance has been updated. NOTE: To accept the transfer, this must return `bytes4(keccak256("onERC1155Received(address,address,uint256,uint256,bytes)"))` (i.e. 0xf23a6e61, or its own function selector).

params.data: Additional data with no specified format
params.from: The address which previously owned the token
params.id: The ID of the token being transferred
params.operator: The address which initiated the transfer (i.e. msg.sender)
params.value: The amount of tokens being transferred

params.metadataVersion: Version of metadata to return policy for

returns.policy: Deposit policy for given metadata version

retire(address,address,uint256,bytes).details: Internally, calls are routed to Retirement Service to facilitate the retirement. Emits a {Retirement} event. Requirements:     - msg.sender must be approved for owner's JLTs     - Owner must have sufficient JLTs     - Owner cannot be zero address

params.beneficiary: Address to receive retirement acknowledgment. If none, assume msg.sender
params.data: Optional calldata to relay to retirement service via onERC1155Received
params.from: JLT owner from which to burn tokens

params.amount: Exact number of JLTs to retire
params.data: Optional calldata to relay to retirement service via onERC1155Received

retirementRate().details: If pool's retirement rate is not set, defer to pool factory's base rate

selectWithdrawTokens(uint256).details: Internal function to select tokens to withdraw from the contract

params.amount: Number of tokens to withdraw from contract

returns.amounts: Number of tokens to withdraw for each token ID

tokenURI().details: Appends token symbol to end of base URI

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

updateRetirementRate(uint96).details: Requirements:     - Caller must have fee manager role - in pool factory emits RetirementRateUpdate

params.newRetirementRate: New rate on retirements in basis points

updateWithdrawalRate(uint96,bool).details: Requirements:     - Caller must have fee manager role - in pool factory emits WithdrawalRateUpdate

params.isSpecificRate: Whether the new rate is for specific tokens or any
params.newWithdrawalRate: New rate on withdrawals in basis points

validateDepositValidity(uint256).details: Checks if an EAT depositted into the pool is frozen and validates internal      balance for token. If frozen, it is internally removed from the pool's      list of withdrawable tokens. If internal count does not match balance,      caller will have their JLT burned to rectify the inbalance.

withdraw(address,uint256,bytes).details: Pool will automatically select EATs to withdraw. Defer to {withdrawSpecific}      if selecting specific EATs to withdraw is important. Requirements:     - msg.sender must have sufficient JLTs     - If recipient is a contract, it must implement onERC1155Received & onERC1155BatchReceived

params.data: Optional calldata to relay to recipient via onERC1155Received

returns.amounts: Number of tokens withdraw, per ID, from the pool  Emits a {Withdraw} event.
returns.tokenIds: Token IDs withdrawn from the pool

withdrawFrom(address,address,uint256,byt.details: Pool will automatically select EATs to withdraw. Defer to {withdrawSpecific}      if selecting specific EATs to withdraw is important. Requirements:     - msg.sender must be approved for owner's JLTs     - Owner must have sufficient JLTs     - If recipient is a contract, it must implement onERC1155Received & onERC1155BatchReceived

params.data: Optional calldata to relay to recipient via onERC1155Received
params.spender: JLT owner from which to burn tokens

returns.amounts: Number of tokens withdraw, per ID, from the pool  Emits a {Withdraw} event.
returns.tokenIds: Token IDs withdrawn from the pool

withdrawSpecific(address,address,uint256.details: Requirements:     - msg.sender must be approved for owner's JLTs     - Length of tokenIds and quantities must match     - Owner must have more JLTs than sum of quantities     - If recipient is a contract, it must implement onERC1155Received & onERC1155BatchReceived     - Owner and Recipient cannot be zero address

params.data: Optional calldata to relay to recipient via onERC1155Received  Emits a {Withdraw} event.
params.quantities: Number of EATs for tokenId at same index to deposit
params.spender: JLT owner from which to burn tokens
params.tokenIds: EAT token IDs to withdraw from pool

returns.cost: Price of withdrawing EATs in JLTs
Price of withdrawing EATs in JLTs

withdrawalRate().details: If pool's withdrawal rate is not set, defer to pool factory's base rate

withdrawalSpecificRate().details: If pool's specific withdrawal rate is not set, defer to pool factory's base rate

Retirement(address,address,uint256).notice: emitted when tokens from a pool are retired

deposit(uint256,uint256).notice: Used to deposit EATs into the pool to receive JLTs.

depositBatch(address,uint256[],uint256[].notice: Used to deposit numerous EATs of different IDs into the pool to receive JLTs.

depositFrom(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Used to deposit EATs from another account into the pool to receive JLTs.

policyForVersion(uint8).notice: Get a pool's deposit policy for a given metadata version

retire(address,address,uint256,bytes).notice: Burns 'quantity' of tokens from 'owner' in the name of 'beneficiary'.

retireExact(address,address,uint256,byte.notice: Retires an exact amount of JLTs. If fees or other conversions are set,         cost of retirement will be greater than amount.

retirementCost(uint256).notice: Cost of retiring JLTs from pool including retirement fees.

retirementRate().notice: Returns the pool's JLT retirement rate in basis points

updateRetirementRate(uint96).notice: Allows pool fee managers to update the retirement rate

updateWithdrawalRate(uint96,bool).notice: Allows pool fee managers to update the withdrawal rate

withdraw(address,uint256,bytes).notice: Withdraw EATs from pool by burning 'quantity' of JLTs from 'owner'.

withdrawFrom(address,address,uint256,byt.notice: Withdraw EATs from pool by burning 'quantity' of JLTs from 'owner'.

withdrawSpecific(address,address,uint256.notice: Withdraw specific EATs from pool by burning the sum of 'quantities' in JLTs from 'owner'.

withdrawalCost(uint256).notice: Cost of withdrawing amount of tokens from pool where pool         selects the tokens to withdraw, including withdrawal fee.

withdrawalCost(uint256[],uint256[]).notice: Cost of withdrawing specified amounts of tokens from pool including         withdrawal fee.

withdrawalRate().notice: Returns the pool's JLT withdrawal rate in basis points

withdrawalSpecificRate().notice: Returns the pool's JLT withdrawal rate for withdrawing specific tokens,         in basis points

userdoc.notice: Jasmine Liquidity Pools allow users to deposit Jasmine EAT tokens into a         pool and receive - pool specific - Jasmine Liquidity Tokens (JLT) in return.
